docs.snippet: The New York Zoological Park has received one of the smallest and yet one of the most interesting of recent donations -- the automobile bug and the subway worm that lighted the path of "Tex" Rickard from his ranch in Uruguay to the Waldorf.

docs.snippet: Lieutenant Joseph Addison of the Ninth Lancers in the English Army, the regiment which charged the German guns at the battle of Mons, arrived yesterday on the Cunarder Lusitania with his wife, who has been nursing the wounded soldiers at the Hotel...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lieutenant Joseph Addison of the Ninth Lancers in the English Army, the regiment which charged the German guns at the battle of Mons, arrived yesterday on the Cunarder Lusitania with his wife, who has been nursing the wounded soldiers at the Hotel Astoria in Paris, now a Red Cross hospital.

docs.snippet: SYRACUSE, N.Y., April 26. -- The political history of New York State was considerably rewritten at the Barnes-Roosevelt trial for libel here today. Several score letters dealing with two periods of State politics, that of 1899, when Colonel Roosevelt...
docs.lead_paragraph: SYRACUSE, N.Y., April 26. -- The political history of New York State was considerably rewritten at the Barnes-Roosevelt trial for libel here today. Several score letters dealing with two periods of State politics, that of 1899, when Colonel Roosevelt was Governor, and that of 1908, when a faction of the Republican State Organization headed by William Barnes, tried to keep Governor Charles Hughes from being renominated, were read into the court record.
docs.abstract: cross-examines Col. Roosevelt in Barnes libel suit

headline.main: ROOSEVELT HAD PLATT FOR GUIDE; Consulted Boss While Governor on Appointments and Bills, as Numerous Letters Show. SHOWED PLATT HIS MESSAGE Wanted Boss's "Trust" Criticism -- Fought Against Vice Presidency -- Light on Second Hughes Campaign. ROOSEVELT HAD PLATT FOR GUIDE
